text: <@U06FKGUFWS1> Create a HubSpot developer Public app and create a Integration in your web app, Show the `Install HubSpot` button, This will initiate the OAuth, once the integration done HubSpot callback the configured url, get the oauth code, exchange the oauth code and get the access token and refresh token, save it in DB, From that you can continue your business logic
In the install HubSpot button, what should be the code in it? Is there an api example of this?
Also won't the access token and refresh token run out once the client exits?
shouldn't we need a webhook ideally to post the data to from the customers?

I have a secondary domain and I would like to show only blog posts that contain certain tags from the primary domain. Should this be a separate blog entirely or does it make sense to only display posts filtered down by the tag?

Hello all!

My name is Cody Holden and I'm the Product Manager for our Platform Integrations and Zapier teams. I'd love to get some feedback on how your HubSpot developer experience has been and any areas in which we could improve.

In particular, it'd be great to speak to anyone who has worked with the *HubSpot<->Zapier Integration* as well. Feel free to *book time with me <http://meetings.HubSpot.com/cody-holden|here>* or reach out directly via email or Slack.
Thanks!

I want to whitelist only <http://verizon.net|verizon.net> domain for my form input, while I checked "block free email providers" option. Is there an option to whitelist only certain domains and leave others blocked by HubSpot? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/what-domains-are-blocked-when-using-the-forms-email-domains-to-block-feature>

Hey everyone,

Quick heads up – stumbled upon something kinda annoying about date properties stamped via workflow vs API. If you're using a workflow to stamp a date, it won't capture the time, just rounds it to a neat 12:00 AM. Thought it'd work like the create date property, but nope. Not sure if this is common knowledge, so just tossing it out there. Check out the attached pic to see what I mean when you pull the date from HubSpot.

Cheers!

Hi all, this is about the CRM and custom properties (I couldn't find a more appropriate channel so here it goes in <#C22PU4LV8|general>).

I am trying to set a default value for a custom property. The property is Yes/No where I want No to be the default. I've seen a few posts like these:
• <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/pre-set-property-default-value/idi-p/315562>
• <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Set-a-default-value-for-a-custom-property/m-p/238580>
but there isn't any final say and the last comments are from a few months back

Does anyone know if there is a way to do this?

Thanks in advance.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Please refer the docs, This will help you to configure the app and install process
